front.title: Advertising a Router's Local Addresses in OSPF TE Extensions

abstract.t: This document describes procedures that enhance OSPF Traffic Engineering (TE) extensions for advertising a router's local addresses. This is needed to enable other routers in a network to compute traffic engineered MPLS LSPs to a given router's local addresses. Currently, the only addresses belonging to a router that are advertised in TE LSAs are the local addresses corresponding to TE enabled links and the local address corresponding to the Router ID.
